summary: This document is a chain of emails from May 2021 between FBI agents discussing the scheduling of an interview with a witness (referred to as 'her') and her attorney, Jeanne, regarding 302 reports that reference Leon Black. The emails coordinate logistics such as location, timing, and the potential need for an interpreter.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Referenced in FBI 302 reports that are being discussed; the agents are preparing to interview a witness in relation to him.

persons.name: Jeanne
persons.context: Identified as the attorney for a witness ('her') who is to be interviewed; the FBI agent communicates with her to schedule the interview.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: FBI agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, coordinating the interview logistics and handling the 302 reports referencing Leon Black.

connections.description: Communicating to schedule an interview for Jeanne's client with the FBI.
The FBI agent is handling 302 reports that reference Leon Black and is arranging an interview related to him.

events.title: Interview scheduling confirmation
events.description: Agreement to meet at 10:30 AM for an interview; request for cell number coordination.

events.title: Conference room reservation and interpreter note
events.description: Conference room reserved for interview; surprise expressed about potential need for an interpreter as it wasn't needed in a prior interview.

events.title: Logistics coordination for interview
events.description: Discussions about using a conference room at 290 Broadway, timing around a 2p-3p meeting, and arranging an interpreter.

events.title: Initial interview planning
events.description: FBI agent offers to help with meeting a witness, plans to speak to her attorney first, and checks availability for an interview.

keyFacts: FBI agents are actively scheduling an interview with a witness and her attorney, Jeanne, in May 2021.
The interview is related to FBI 302 reports that reference Leon Black.
Logistical details include booking a conference room at 290 Broadway and considering the need for an interpreter.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigation activities by the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk.
